title: 108_s1582
content:
The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 may be cited as the "Valles Caldera Preservation Act." Amendments to the Act are outlined in Section 2. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 is amended to allow the acquisition of mineral interests with available funds, removing the requirement for negotiations on a willing seller basis. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act of 2004 is amended to allow the acquisition of mineral interests with available funds. If negotiations are unsuccessful, the Secretary shall acquire the interests pursuant to section 3114 of title 40, United States Code. Any difference in compensation amounts will be paid from the permanent judgment appropriation under section 1304 of title 31, United States Code. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to allow the Trust to determine obligations and expenditures, and solicit donations through the Board of Trustees and designated employees. (c) Solicitation of Donations.--The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to specify that the Board of Trustees, the executive director, and one additional employee in an executive position designated by the Board or director may solicit donations. 

(d) Use of Proceeds.--The Act is further amended to include proceeds from claims, judgments, or settlements arising from activities on the Baca Ranch or the Preserve after October 27, 1999. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to allow the Board of Trustees, executive director, and one additional employee to solicit donations. Section 107(e) of the Valles Caldera Preservation Act is amended to specify the selection and compensation of trustees, with the chair potentially receiving compensation at a rate determined by the Board of Trustees. The chair of the Board of Trustees may receive compensation based on the annual rate of pay for level IV of the Executive Schedule, not exceeding 25 percent of that amount for a fiscal year. SEC. 4. RESOURCE MANAGEMENT. Property Disposal Limitations amended under the Valles Caldera Preservation Act to include exclusions for the disposal of real property, excluding forage, forest products, or marketable renewable resources. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act has been amended to exclude the disposal of real property, with exceptions for forage, forest products, and marketable renewable resources. Additionally, amendments have been made regarding law enforcement and fire management responsibilities. The Valles Caldera Preservation Act has been amended to include fire management responsibilities, such as developing a plan for fire preparedness, suppression, and emergency rehabilitation services on the Preserve in consultation with the Trust. The plan for fire management on the Valles Caldera Preserve must be consistent with the management program and may include cooperative agreements for services with the Trust on a reimbursable basis. The Senate passed the bill on September 15, 2004. Attest: EMILY J. REYNOLDS, Secretary.
